page.title: 15Village shop and Post Office
page.content: There is a small wooden shop in the middle of village.The busy shopkeeper, Libby,lives near the shop with her husband and two daughters.Libby whose family have lived here for at least five generations,is a church elder and member of the village hall commit- tee.Local people and tourists can buy all they need from the shop.The postlady delivers supplies to more isolated people who all have postboxes at their road end.If they have mail to be collected,they put a stone on top of their box so the postlady will know. Libby gives tourists directions to holiday houses,petrol and diesel stations and fishing lochs.Notices in the shop window tell about function and activities.Her husband and brother bring groceries and special orders from Glasgow cash and carries.
